name: Donald Glover
religion: Donald Glover was raised a Jehovah's Witness, but now he doesn't seem very concerned with religion.
politicalViews: He is a Democrat and is involved in some American racial politics.
author: Caitlin Frye

content.text: Donald Glover was born on Edwards Air Force Base near Los Angeles, California and was raised in Stone Mountain, Georgia.

content.sourceTitle: Donald Glover Is More Talented Than You.
content.text: Glover grew up in a Jehovah's Witness family, and he doesn't necessarily look back on the religion with fondness. He wasn't allowed to watch television

content.sourceTitle: Community Star Donald Glover: My Quirky Holiday.
content.text: or celebrate his birthday, and he didn't get any presents on Christmas.

content.sourceTitle: NBC Star Donald Glover is a One-Man Show.
content.text: And he felt like the weirdo at school because of his family's religion.

content.sourceTitle: Community Star Donald Glover: My Quirky Holiday.
content.text: Jewish kids talk a lot of smack about not having Christmas, but at least people know what they are. People either have no idea what a Jehovah's Witness is or they assume you're responsible for the Jehovah's Witness who knocked on their door last Saturday and woke them up. Neither is a good starting point.

content.sourceTitle: Donald Glover Is More Talented Than You.
content.text: While in college, he started experimenting with things forbidden in his youth,

content.sourceTitle: Donald Glover Is More Talented Than You.
content.text: and he has since dropped his childhood religion

content.sourceTitle: NBC Star Donald Glover is a One-Man Show.
content.text: for a life in show business–complete with plenty of booze and pre-marital sex.

content.sourceTitle: "Won't Stop" lyrics by CHILDISH GAMBINO [a.k.a. DONALD GLOVER].
content.text: The only mention I could find about Glover's current spiritual leanings, or lack thereof, is in his song "Won't Stop" where he calls himself an "airport atheist" who only "pray[s] when there's turbulence."
Whatever the case, it doesn't seem to be getting in the way of him having a good time.

content.sourceTitle: Donald Glover: Obama Is A Black Nerd.
content.text: As a start, Donald Glover feels like he has a kindred spirit in Barack Obama. After all, they're both black nerds.

content.sourceTitle: donald glover's federal campaign contribution search results.
content.text: He also donated to the president's campaign in 2008,
so I think we can call him a Democrat.

He doesn't get involved with many specific political issues, but he has willingly been drawn into racial politics. In 2010, Glover was involved in an internet campaign–started by fans and embraced by him–to get him an audition for the next Spider-Man.
It was about getting a black man into a prime slot on the comic book register, but he says he wasn't trying to "stir something up."

content.sourceTitle: NBC Star Donald Glover is a One-Man Show.
content.text: I was halfway joking. People are like, "There are plenty of black superheroes that are just as good." And I'm like, that sounds like "separate but equal" . . . and it's not true.

content.sourceTitle: Donald Glover Talks New ULTIMATE SPIDER-MAN.
content.text: A white Spider-Man was cast, but now there's a black Spider-Man comic book series that was inspired by Glover.
So it turns out his half-joke did do something positive for the black nerd community after all.

ImageDescription.value: Actor Donald Glover attends the world premiere for "The Martian” on day two of the Toronto International Film Festival at the Roy Thomson Hall, Friday, Sept. 11, 2015 in Toronto. NASA scientists and engineers served as technical consultants on the film. The movie portrays a realistic view of the climate and topography of Mars, based on NASA data, and some of the challenges NASA faces as we prepare for human exploration of the Red Planet in the 2030s.
